Description: Group of six model axe-heads: of rounded form with lugs, very roughly fashioned. Only the largest has fully formed lugs. All are thickly corroded, the largest bearing clear traces of a wooden haft.
Curator's comments: These axes were found with 28 other models from the same source. The original group, as discovered, contained nine axes in all.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (30)
